article:
There are at least two interpretations of 'Unknown knowns'. The first is that
they are things that we knew but have forgotten. The other is that they are the
things that we know, but are unaware of knowing. The coining of the term is
attributed to Slovenian Philosopher Slavoj Å½iÅ¾ek and it refers to the
unconscious beliefs and prejudices that determine how we perceive reality and
intervene in it. It is the Freudian unconscious, the âknowledge which doesnât
know itself,â as Jacques Lacan
said. http://www.lacan.com/zizekrumsfeld.htm
